title: User Signup with Valid Data
description: Verify that a new user can register successfully with valid email, password, username, and role, and receives email verification.

steps.description: Navigate to the signup page.
Enter valid username, valid email, secure password, and select a valid role (student, host, or admin).
Submit the registration form.
Verify response status 201 and user creation confirmation message.
Verify an email verification token is sent to the provided email.

title: User Signup with Invalid Email Format
description: Verify registration fails when user provides an invalid email address format.

steps.description: Navigate to the signup page.
Enter valid username, invalid email format, secure password, and select valid role.
Submit the registration form.
Verify response status 400 and appropriate error message about invalid email.

title: User Login with Valid Credentials
description: Verify users can log in successfully with correct username and password and receive JWT tokens.

steps.description: Navigate to login page.
Enter valid username and password.
Submit login form.
Verify response 200 with access and refresh JWT tokens and user role included.

title: User Login with Invalid Credentials
description: Verify login fails when incorrect username or password is provided.

steps.description: Navigate to login page.
Enter invalid username or password.
Submit login form.
Verify response 401 Unauthorized and proper error message.

title: Email Verification with Valid Token
description: Verify that a user account activates successfully upon providing a valid email verification token.

steps.description: Retrieve valid email verification token from email.
Submit the token to verification endpoint.
Verify response 200 with success message and account activation.

title: Email Verification with Invalid or Expired Token
description: Verify email verification fails with invalid or expired token.

steps.description: Submit invalid or expired token to verification endpoint.
Verify response 400 with error message indicating invalid or expired token.

title: Event Creation by Host
description: Verify that a logged-in host can create an event with valid details including date, time, duration, and optional venue.

steps.description: Log in as host.
Navigate to event creation page.
Fill in event details: name, description, date, time, duration, optional venue, grace period.
Submit event creation form.
Verify response 201 and event details are saved and retrievable.

title: Event Creation with Missing Required Fields
description: Verify event creation fails when required fields like name or date are missing.

steps.description: Log in as host.
Attempt to create event leaving required fields empty.
Submit the form.
Verify response 400 with validation error messages.

title: Join Event with Valid Join Code
description: Verify an attendee can join an event by providing a valid join code.

steps.description: Log in as attendee.
Submit valid join code to join event endpoint.
Verify response 200 and success message confirming event enrollment.

title: Join Event with Invalid Join Code
description: Verify joining event fails with an invalid or nonexistent join code.

steps.description: Log in as attendee.
Submit invalid join code.
Verify response 404 with error message: 'Invalid code'.

title: Face Enrollment with Valid Image
description: Verify attendees can enroll their face by uploading a clear facial image which is processed and stored encrypted.

steps.description: Log in as attendee.
Upload valid base64 encoded facial image to face enrollment endpoint.
Verify response 200 with success message indicating face enrollment.

title: Face Enrollment with Invalid Image Data
description: Verify face enrollment fails when uploaded image is invalid, corrupt or missing.

steps.description: Log in as attendee.
Attempt to upload invalid or empty base64 image data.
Verify response 400 with error message indicating bad request.

title: Mark Attendance with Recognized Face
description: Verify attendance is marked successfully for a recognized face image submitted within the event time window.

steps.description: Host starts attendance session for an event.
Submit base64 image of enrolled attendee's face and event ID to attendance mark endpoint.
Verify attendance marked with status present or late depending on time, and correct timestamp.

title: Mark Attendance with Unrecognized Face
description: Verify attendance marking fails when face is not recognized or face data is not enrolled.

steps.description: Submit base64 image of a non-enrolled or unknown user for event attendance marking.
Verify response 400 with error message 'Face not recognized or already marked'.

title: Mark Attendance for Nonexistent Event
description: Verify API returns not found error when attendance is marked for an event ID that does not exist.

steps.description: Submit attendance marking request with a valid face image but invalid event ID.
Verify response 404 with 'Event not found' message.

title: Retrieve Attendance Records as Host
description: Verify hosts can retrieve full attendance records for their events with correct data and status.

steps.description: Log in as host.
Request attendance records for events owned by the host.
Verify response 200 and records include correct event IDs, student IDs, status, timestamp.

title: Retrieve Attendance Records as Attendee
description: Verify attendees can retrieve only their own attendance records, without data leakage.

steps.description: Log in as attendee.
Request attendance records.
Verify response 200 and data contains only attendance records for logged-in user.

title: Manual Override Attendance Status by Host
description: Verify hosts can manually override attendance statuses for attendees within allowed constraints.

steps.description: Log in as host.
Navigate to attendance dashboard.
Select an attendance record and change status (e.g., from absent to present).
Verify override is saved, reflected in attendance logs and restrict unauthorized roles from performing this.

title: User Profile Update Without Biometric Data
description: Verify users can update their profile details such as name, phone but cannot update biometric data directly.

steps.description: Log in as any user.
Attempt to update profile details like name, phone.
Verify updates succeed with 200 response.
Attempt to update or upload biometric data through profile update endpoint.
Verify system forbids direct biometric updates; such action should fail or be ignored.

title: Delete Face Data with Confirmation
description: Verify attendees can request deletion of their face biometric data and receive a confirmation email.

steps.description: Log in as attendee with enrolled face data.
Initiate biometric data deletion request with confirmation step.
Verify biometric templates are removed from storage.
Verify confirmation email is sent to user.

title: Generate Attendance Report with Filters
description: Verify hosts can generate attendance reports filtered by event or date range and export in CSV and PDF format.

steps.description: Log in as host.
Apply filters by event and date range on attendance report page.
Trigger export to CSV.
Verify generated CSV file contains filtered attendance data accurately.
Trigger export to PDF.
Verify generated PDF report matches the filtered data.

title: Automated Notifications Sent Before Event
description: Verify that automated email and dashboard notifications/reminders are sent and logged before scheduled events.

steps.description: Schedule an event with reminder configured.
Verify that reminder emails are sent to registered attendees before event start time.
Verify dashboard banners are displayed on user dashboards as notification.

title: Role-based Dashboard Access Control
description: Verify users access only their permitted dashboard views based on their roles (admin, host, attendee).

steps.description: Login as each role (admin, host, attendee) separately.
Attempt to access dashboards meant for other roles.
Verify each role only accesses authorized dashboards; unauthorized accesses return 403 or redirect.

title: System Behavior under Camera Failure
description: Verify the system handles webcam feed failure gracefully during real-time attendance marking.

steps.description: Host initiates attendance session with webcam enabled.
Simulate webcam hardware failure or denial of camera access.
Verify system displays appropriate error message and does not crash.

title: System Resilience under Network Failure
description: Verify system handles temporary network interruptions during attendance marking or data retrieval without data loss.

steps.description: Perform attendance marking or data fetch with intermittent network failure.
Verify system retries operations or shows meaningful error and recovers gracefully.

title: Security Compliance of Biometric Data Storage
description: Verify that face biometric data is stored encrypted and access is restricted to authorized users only.

steps.description: Enroll face biometric image.
Verify biometric embedding data is encrypted in database storage.
Attempt unauthorized access to biometric data and verify access denial.
